intro: Digitacalia, commonly known as the African buttercup, is a genus of flowering plants native to southern Africa. These plants are characterized by their showy, yellow or orange flowers that resemble those of the buttercup family. Digitacalia species typically have hairy leaves and are often found in rocky or sandy soils. They are herbaceous perennials that produce small, capsule-like fruits. The genus includes several species, some of which are cultivated for their ornamental value.
